[ <a href='/results.php?city=linwood' rel='city origin'>Linwood</a> Louisiana ], Tuesday, <a rel="month origin" value="4">April</a> <a rel='day origin' value='7'>7th</a>. [<a href='/results.php?year=1863' rel="origin">1863</a>]
</p><p>
I believe that it is for true that we are to leave for <a href='/results.php?city=new orleans' rel='city'>New Orleans</a>, via <a href='/results.php?city=clinton' rel='city'>Clinton</a> and Ponchatoula, this 
evening. <a href='/results.php?city=clinton' rel='city'>Clinton</a>, at least, I am sure of. Lilly came down for me yesterday, and according to the present programme, though I will not answer for it in an 
hour from now, we leave <a href='/results.php?city=linwood' rel='city'>Linwood</a> this evening, and <a href='/results.php?city=clinton' rel='city'>Clinton</a> on Thursday. I am almost indifferent about 
our destination; my chief anxiety is to have some definite plans decided on, which seems perfectly impossible from the number of times they are 
changed a day. The uncertainty is really affecting my spine, and causing me to grow alarmingly thin 
</p><p>
</letter>
